derivation: perhaps from (a leek, and so an onion-patch);
strongs_def: a garden plot, i.e. (by implication, of regular beds) a row (repeated in plural by Hebraism, to indicate an arrangement)
outline:
1. a plot of ground, a garden bed
  2. Hebrew idiom i.e. they reclined in ranks or divisions, so that several ranks formed, as it were separate plots
